At BJAK, we’re using AI to reinvent how financial services work across Southeast Asia — making them smarter, simpler, and more inclusive. As a Full Stack Engineer AI, you’ll bridge machine learning and software engineering to bring intelligent features directly into users’ hands.


You’ll operate across the stack — from backend systems and ML model integration to frontend delivery — and help shape how millions of users experience intelligent financial services. This is a remote role based in Singapore, working closely with our Malaysia HQ and cross-functional regional teams.


WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS

 - You’ll be the critical link between AI models and user-facing features

 - Your work will define how intelligence is delivered to millions of users

 - You’ll build end-to-end systems that combine backend, ML, and frontend engineering

 - You’ll thrive in a lean, fast-moving team that values bold execution and real-world impact


WHAT YOU’LL DO

 - Build and deploy full-stack applications that leverage machine learning models

 - Collaborate with ML engineers and data scientists to integrate models into production

 - Develop backend services, APIs, and pipelines to power intelligent features

 - Build intuitive and performant UIs that surface AI insights clearly and meaningfully

 - Own the full development lifecycle — architecture, implementation, testing, deployment, and monitoring

 - Work with product, design, and engineering teams to deliver seamless user experiences

 - Continuously improve the performance, scalability, and reliability of AI-integrated systems


YOU’LL THRIVE HERE IF YOU...

 - Love shipping fast — you’d rather launch V1 this week than perfect V3 six months later

 - Treat every problem as your own, regardless of scope or title

 - Enjoy switching hats — builder, debugger, architect, and product thinker when needed

 - Believe clarity comes from action — prototype, test, and iterate without waiting for perfect plans

 - Stay calm and effective in startup chaos — shifting priorities and building from zero doesn’t faze you

 - See feedback and failure as part of growth — you're here to level up

 - Believe “done” beats “perfect,” but still care deeply about UX and code quality

 - Show up with humility, hunger, and hustle — and lift up others as you go


REQUIREMENTS

 - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field

 - 2–4 years of experience in full stack development (frontend + backend)

 - Strong coding skills in Python is a MUST and JavaScript (Node.js, React), or similar stacks

 - Experience integrating machine learning models into production applications

 - Solid understanding of API development, RESTful services, and cloud deployment

 - Comfortable working with SQL/NoSQL databases and scalable system architecture

 - Proficient in debugging, testing, and modern software design best practices

 - Must be a Singaporean citizen or Permanent Resident (PR)

 - Must be willing to relocate to Malaysia or work remotely from Singapore


NICE TO HAVE

 - Experience with tools like FastAPI, Flask, TensorFlow Serving for ML model deployment

 - Familiarity with frontend frameworks like Next.js, Vue, or TypeScript

 - Exposure to ML lifecycle and ops tools (MLflow, Airflow, Docker, GCP/AWS)

 - Experience in high-growth startup or agile product development teams

 - Understanding of AI explainability and data visualization in user interfaces


WHAT YOU’LL GET

 - Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

 - Hybrid flexibility — work from home and collaborate in-office at HQ

 - High-impact role with visibility across product, data, and engineering

 - Flat structure — your work is seen, your ideas are heard

 - Fast learning curve and accelerated growth in a mission-driven company

 - Regional exposure across Southeast Asian markets


ABOUT BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform. Headquartered in Malaysia with operations in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent financial protection. We use AI, automation, and APIs to simplify complex financial products — making them accessible, faster, and fairer.

If you're excited to bring AI to life through full stack engineering and want to build products that reach millions — we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: AI Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

At Bjak, we are committed to making financial services more accessible, affordable, and sustainable across ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance platform in Southeast Asia, helping millions find the best value and highest coverage insurance policies through our platform, Bjak.com.

We leverage cutting-edge technology, including Custom APIs, trading systems, and data science, to simplify financial services that were once complex and inaccessible. Our expertise in navigating complex regulations has enabled us to develop innovative products, such as offering investment-linked life and health insurance online with instant agent support.

The role is open to Singaporean citizens and Permanent Residents (PRs) based in Singapore, who are willing to relocate to Malaysia or work remotely from Singapore while collaborating closely with our Malaysia-based team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define AI and machine learning objectives, requirements, and timelines.

  • Design, develop, and implement AI models, algorithms, and applications to solve complex business challenges.

  • Manage the end-to-end AI model lifecycle, including data collection, pre processing, model training, evaluation, and deployment.

  • Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, integrating best practices into projects.

  • Optimize AI models for scalability, efficiency, and security.

  • Utilize data-driven insights and advanced analytics for continuous improvements.

  • Conduct research to explore and integrate innovative AI techniques.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.

  • Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, AI Engineer, or Data Scientist.

  • Strong proficiency in Python is a must

  • Proficiency in AI and machine learning frameworks and programming languages (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).

  • Expertise in data pre processing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking skills.

  • Effective communication and teamwork abilities.

  • Must be a Singaporean citizen or Permanent Resident (PR).

  • Must be willing to relocate to Malaysia or work remotely from Singapore.

Benefits

  • Remote work arrangement

  • Open to remote work from Singapore for suitable candidates

  • Work closely with an international team based in Malaysia

  • Dynamic and fast-paced work environment

  • Attractive remuneration and performance incentives

  • Strong learning and career growth opportunities

  • Competitive salary

jobs.title: Founding Lead AI Engineer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
📍 Working Arrangement: Singapore(Remote - work from anywhere in Singapore)

Shape AI That Powers the Future of Financial Access Across Southeast Asia

At BJAK, we’re using AI to solve meaningful problems — from fraud detection and risk modeling to hyper-personalized financial experiences that make insurance and financial services more accessible. We’re looking for a Founding Lead AI Engineer based in Singapore to play a pivotal role in building, scaling, and leading the next generation of intelligent systems.

This role blends deep technical expertise with hands-on leadership, reporting directly to our Head of AI. You’ll write production code, shape strategy, mentor team members, and help grow a lean, world-class AI engineering team.

Why This Role Matters

  • You’ll design and deploy core AI systems that serve millions across the region

  • You’ll be the right hand to the Head of AI — driving technical execution and engineering standards

  • You’ll lead and mentor junior engineers to elevate team performance and capabilities

  • You’ll play a critical role in hiring and scaling a high-performance AI team

What You’ll Do

  • Design, build, and ship production-grade ML models for high-impact use cases

  • Lead model architecture, data pipeline design, and deployment strategies

  • Collaborate across product, engineering, and data teams to drive AI initiatives

  • Own the end-to-end ML lifecycle — from data prep to deployment and monitoring

  • Review code, guide projects, and mentor engineers through technical challenges

  • Champion experimentation, continuous learning, and AI best practices

  • Interview and evaluate candidates, contributing to technical hiring and team building

  • Stay ahead of ML advancements — and bring cutting-edge solutions into production

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Lead from the front — you’re hands-on in code, but always lifting others

  • Think like an owner — you don’t wait for permission to solve a problem

  • Operate at speed and depth — you make fast, sound decisions that balance trade-offs

  • Push for clarity — even in chaos, you bring structure, direction, and accountability

  • Care about what ships — you focus on solving real-world problems, not just academic ones

  • Grow the team, not just the tech — you enjoy mentoring, coaching, and seeing others win

  • Adapt fast — priorities shift, ambiguity is the norm, and you navigate both with confidence

  • Have a builder’s mindset — fast prototypes, strong opinions, and a hunger to iterate

  • Keep learning — you’re constantly leveling up your technical, product, and leadership game

Requirements

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

  • 4–6 years of experience in AI/ML engineering with real-world deployment experience

  • Strong proficiency in Python is a must

  • Deep familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)

  • Solid understanding of the end-to-end ML lifecycle: data pipelines, training, validation, monitoring

  • Experience working on applied AI problems (e.g., recommendation, fraud, risk, NLP, etc.)

  • Track record of technical leadership and mentoring engineers

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

  • Must be based in Singapore and open to working remotely with regional teams

Nice to Have

  • Experience with MLOps tooling (e.g., MLflow, Airflow, Docker, GCP/AWS)

  • Familiarity with responsible AI practices (fairness, interpretability, model governance)

  • Startup or scale-up environment experience

  • Exposure to building internal tools, reusable ML components, or AI platforms

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

  • Fully remote and flexible work arrangement from anywhere in Singpore

  • High ownership role with impact visible at a regional scale

  • Direct reporting line to Head of AI with exposure to senior leadership

  • Opportunity to lead and shape a growing AI engineering team

  • Fast-track career growth and learning opportunities in a high-speed environment

  • Collaborative, flat culture where ideas move fast and great work gets noticed

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform, serving millions of users with transparent, affordable financial protection. Headquartered in Malaysia, and active in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we’re building AI-driven systems that make complex financial services accessible, fast, and fair.

We believe in technology that moves fast and serves real needs — from personalized pricing engines to smart automation and fraud detection. Join us in reshaping the future of financial access across Asia.

If you’re ready to build, lead, and scale AI that matters — and want to grow with a company that thinks big and moves fast — we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer (Diffusion / Vision)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Transform Visual Models into Real-World Applications

We’re building AI systems for a global audience. We are living in an era of AI transition - this new project team will be focusing on building applications to enable more real world impact and highest usage for the world.

This role is a global role with remote work arrangement. You’ll work closely with regional teams across product, engineering, operations, infrastructure and data to build and scale impactful AI solutions.

Why This Role Matters

You’ll fine-tune state-of-the-art models, design evaluation frameworks, and bring AI features into production. Your work ensures our models are not only intelligent, but also safe, trustworthy, and impactful at scale.

What You’ll Do

  • Fine-tune & Adapt – Train and customize diffusion models (SDXL, Flux, Stable Diffusion variants) using LoRA, DreamBooth, and other parameter-efficient methods.

  • Curate Datasets – Build, clean, and annotate large-scale image datasets with captioning, tagging, and NSFW filtering for safe and aligned generation.

  • Evaluate & Align – Develop pipelines to measure fidelity, diversity, style adherence, and safety across generated outputs.

  • Optimize Performance – Apply GPU memory optimization, latent diffusion tricks, and distributed training for efficient scaling.

  • Deploy & Monitor – Ship diffusion-powered features into production with monitoring for drift, latency, and quality.

  • Collaborate & Deliver – Work with product and design to integrate generative vision capabilities into user experiences.

What Is It Like

  • Likes ownership and independence

  • Believe clarity comes from action - prototype, test, and iterate without waiting for perfect plans.

  • Stay calm and effective in startup chaos - shifting priorities and building from zero doesn’t faze you.

  • Bias for speed - you believe it’s better to deliver something valuable now than a perfect version much later.

  • See feedback and failure as part of growth - you’re here to level up.

  • Possess humility, hunger, and hustle, and lift others up as you go.

Requirements

  • Strong experience with diffusion models and generative vision (Stable Diffusion, SDXL, Flux, etc.).

  • Hands-on skills with DreamBooth, LoRA/QLoRA, and fine-tuning methods.

  • Proficiency with PyTorch (preferred).

  • Experience in dataset preparation (captioning, tagging, filtering, augmentation).

  • Knowledge of GPU optimization, latent diffusion, and efficient training techniques.

  • Strong foundations in software engineering, algorithms, and clean code practices.

Nice to Have

  • Prior work in style transfer, personalization, or multimodal generation.

  • Experience with safety alignment in generative vision (NSFW detection, adversarial testing).

  • Open-source contributions in diffusion or generative vision projects.

What You’ll Get

  • Flat structure & real ownership

  • Full involvement in direction and consensus decision making

  • Flexibility in work arrangement

  • High-impact role with visibility across product, data, and engineering

  • Top-of-market compensation and performance-based bonuses

  • Global exposure to product development

  • Lots of perks - housing rental subsidies, a quality company cafeteria, and overtime meals

  • Health, dental & vision insurance

  • Global travel insurance (for you & your dependents)

  • Unlimited, flexible time off

Our Team & Culture

We’re a densed, high-performance team focused on high quality work and global impact. We behave like owners. We value speed, clarity, and relentless ownership. If you’re hungry to grow and care deeply about excellence, join us.

About Bjak

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s #1 insurance aggregator with 8M+ users, fully owned by its employees. Headquartered in Malaysia and operating in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we help millions of users access transparent and affordable financial protection through Bjak.com. We simplify complex financial products through cutting-edge technologies, including APIs, automation, and AI, to build the next generation of intelligent financial systems.

If you're excited to build real-world AI systems and grow fast in a high-impact environment, we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: AI Engineer (Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Shape AI That Powers the Future of Financial Access Across Southeast Asia


At BJAK, we’re using AI to solve meaningful problems - from fraud detection and risk modeling to personalized experiences that make insurance and financial services more inclusive. We’re looking for a AI Engineer based in Singapore to play a key role in building and scaling these systems.


This role combines senior-level engineering depth with team leadership, reporting directly to our Head of AI. You’ll be both an individual contributor and a technical mentor, working hands-on with models while also guiding junior engineers and contributing to the team's growth.

Why This Role Matters

  • You’ll build core AI systems that serve millions of users across the region.

  • You’ll act as the right hand to the Head of AI, shaping direction, execution, and standards.

  • You’ll help build a lean, high-performance AI team by interviewing, mentoring, and coaching.

  • You’ll set the technical bar, leading by example in code quality, delivery, and problem-solving

What You’ll Do

  • Design and deploy production-grade machine learning models for business-critical use cases.

  • Collaborate closely with engineering, data, and product teams to identify and deliver AI solution

  • Lead technical decisions on model architecture, system design, and deployment pipelines.

  • Own end-to-end model lifecycle: from data preparation to training, validation, monitoring, and retraining

  • Act as a mentor to junior AI engineers - reviewing code, guiding projects, and supporting growth

  • Support hiring: interview candidates, evaluate technical fit, and contribute to building a world-class team

  • Champion AI best practices, experimentation, and continuous improvement

  • Stay current with AI advancements and evaluate what’s worth bringing into our stack

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Are both a builder and a leader - you roll up your sleeves and raise the bar for others

  • Get excited about shipping AI systems that work in the real world

  • Enjoy helping teammates grow and succeed - and do it without ego

  • Can bring clarity and structure to ambiguity

  • Thrive in a high-ownership, fast-paced startup culture

  • Care about impact - not just model accuracy, but how it affects users and business

  • Think feedback, iteration, and learning are part of the job - not afterthoughts

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

  • 4–6 years of experience in AI engineering, with production deployment experience

  • Strong proficiency in Python is a must

  • Deep familiarity with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)

  • Experience working on real-world AI applications (e.g., risk scoring, recommendation, NLP, etc.)

  • Experience mentoring engineers and collaborating across functions

  • Strong communication skills - able to work cross-functionally and provide technical leadership

  • Must be based in Singapore and able to work remotely with Malaysia HQ

Nice to Have

  • Experience with MLOps tooling (MLflow, Airflow, Docker, GCP/AWS)

  • Familiarity with model explainability, fairness, or responsible AI practices

  • Background in startup or high-growth tech environments

  • Exposure to building internal AI tools, frameworks, or reusable components

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive salary and performance bonuses

  • Fully remote, flexible work setup from anywhere in Singapore

  • High ownership, visible impact, and direct reporting to the Head of AI

  • Fast career growth in a company scaling across ASEAN

  • Opportunity to lead a lean, smart team solving meaningful problems

  • Access to cross-border collaboration and regional product exposure

Headquartered in Malaysia and operating across Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we simplify financial products using AI, automation, and smart systems, making them accessible, fast, and fair. Join us to shape the future of AI-driven finance.

If you’re ready to build, lead, and scale AI that matters - and grow with a company that moves fast and thinks big - we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

At BJAK, we’re building intelligent infrastructure to transform how insurance and financial services operate at scale across Southeast Asia. As we grow rapidly, our systems must be secure, reliable, and able to handle millions of users without compromise.

We’re looking for a Backend Software Engineer (Node.js) to join our engineering team in Malaysia and take ownership of critical backend services - from APIs and architecture to performance optimization and deployment.

This is a hands-on, high-impact role for someone who thrives on building reliable systems, writing clean code, and solving tough backend challenges. You’ll work closely with product, data, and frontend teams to bring scalable solutions to life, fast.

This role is based in Malaysia with a hybrid work arrangement.

Why This Role Matters

  • Power mission-critical platforms that serve millions of users across Southeast Asia.

  • Own and optimize high-performance backend systems that impact real-time financial decision-making.

  • Enable rapid product development through reliable infrastructure and scalable APIs.

  • Be part of a fast-moving team that ships quality work and scales with urgency.

What You’ll Do

  • Design, build, and maintain robust backend services and APIs using Node.js and modern frameworks (e.g., NestJS, ExpressJS, GraphQL).

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support new features and drive technical decisions.

  • Ensure production systems are scalable, stable, and secure, with strong monitoring and alerting in place.

  • Refactor legacy systems for performance, maintainability, and clarity.

  • Lead and participate in code reviews, design discussions, and knowledge sharing.

  • Support integration, deployment, and post-release debugging to ensure system reliability.

  • Help define and uphold backend engineering best practices across the team.

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Care deeply about code quality, performance, and clean architecture.

  • Take initiative to solve problems independently and without being micromanaged.

  • Are comfortable in a fast-moving environment where priorities shift quickly.

  • Have strong attention to detail, but don’t let it stop you from shipping.

  • Enjoy collaborating with product, data, and design teams to build real solutions.

  • Are self-motivated, low-ego, and focused on outcomes.

What You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.

  • 3+ years of full-time experience in backend engineering roles.

  • Strong proficiency in Node.js, with practical experience using frameworks like NestJS, ExpressJS, or GraphQL.

  • Solid knowledge of databases such as MongoDB, MySQL, or similar.

  • Familiarity with tools like Postman, Selenium, Cypress, or Puppeteer.

  • A strong grasp of data structures, algorithms, and system design.

  • Clear, professional communication and the ability to work effectively in a hybrid team.

  • Based in Malaysia and open to hybrid work.

Nice to Have

  • Experience deploying services to AWS, GCP, or other cloud environments.

  • Familiarity with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, or Infrastructure as Code practices.

  • Exposure to Test-Driven Development (TDD) or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD).

  • Portfolio or GitHub repositories that showcase your technical capabilities.

  • Prior experience working in a high-growth or startup environment.

Our Team & Culture

We’re a lean, high-performance team that moves fast and holds a high bar. Titles don’t matter here - output, ownership, and problem-solving do. Everyone is expected to contribute, improve the system, and take initiative.

We reward people who build with clarity and move with urgency. We value engineers who take full ownership of their work, think end-to-end, and never stop learning.

If you’re hungry to grow, enjoy solving challenging technical problems, and want to build something that matters, you’ll fit right in.

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

  • Hybrid work flexibility - remote convenience with in-office collaboration.

  • Autonomy and ownership from day one.

  • Exposure to large-scale, production-grade systems used by millions.

  • Fast-paced growth environment with strong engineering mentorship.

  • A team that values impact, speed, and continuous improvement.

We simplify complex financial services using cutting-edge technologies - including automation, APIs, and AI - to deliver a faster, smarter, and more inclusive financial experience.

This is a data-driven, high-accountability role designed for someone who thrives on managing complexity, optimizing campaigns at scale, and extracting meaningful ROI from every ad dollar spent.

You’ll be the person behind the controls - setting up campaigns, running experiments, fixing tracking, analyzing results, and constantly pushing performance higher.

What You’ll Do

  • Plan, launch, and optimize paid digital campaigns across Meta (Facebook/Instagram), Google Ads, TikTok, and other relevant platforms.

  • Monitor and analyze campaign KPIs (CTR, CPC, CPA, ROAS) daily to ensure performance targets are met or exceeded.

  • Conduct A/B testing on ad creatives, copy, audiences, placements, and bidding strategies to identify what works.

  • Collaborate with content and design teams to craft high-performing ads and landing experiences.

  • Troubleshoot issues related to ad delivery, tracking, targeting, or performance drops in real time.

  • Manage campaign budgets across channels, ensuring efficient allocation and maximum ROI.

  • Build detailed weekly and monthly reports, highlighting key insights, optimization actions, and budget usage.

  • Stay up to date on platform changes, beta features, algorithm updates, and new ad formats.

  • Set up and manage conversion tracking using UTM parameters, pixels, and Google Tag Manager.

  • Conduct audience research and segmentation to target high-intent and high-converting user groups.

  • Coordinate with vendors, agencies, or partners to execute large-scale or specialized campaign initiatives.

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Live and breathe performance marketing and get excited when CTR jumps by 2%.

  • Love testing and retesting from headlines to audience slices to bidding methods.

  • Are obsessed with numbers, patterns, and uncovering what’s working and what’s not.

  • Move fast and execute independently without needing to be micromanaged.

  • Know how to communicate findings with clarity, and suggest what to do next.

  • Operate with urgency, ownership, and a startup mentality; your results speak for you.

  • Can juggle multiple campaigns, deadlines, and adjustments with focus and precision.

What You Bring

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Business, or related field.

  • Proven experience in digital advertising operations or performance marketing roles.

  • Hands-on expertise in Facebook Business Manager, Google Ads, TikTok Ads, and related ad tools.

  • Proficiency in analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Meta Ads Reporting, and campaign dashboards.

  • Strong understanding of ad formats, bidding strategies, campaign structures, and targeting mechanisms.

  • Experience with conversion tracking, including UTM parameters, pixel setup, and Google Tag Manager.

  • Familiarity with retargeting strategies, audience segmentation, and programmatic display.

  • Exceptional attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple campaigns at once.

  • Certification in Google Ads, Meta Blueprint, or similar is highly desirable.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in a high-growth startup or digital-first company.

  • Knowledge of SEO, email marketing, or affiliate/performance partner networks.

  • Exposure to marketing automation tools or CRM platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Braze).

  • Familiarity with Looker Studio, Tableau, or custom BI dashboards.

Our Team & Culture

We move fast. We’re lean. We don’t do fluff - we do results. Everyone at BJAK is expected to take ownership of their work, speak up with ideas, and move the needle. As a digital marketing team, we act like operators - we don’t just set campaigns live, we track, tweak, and scale what works.

If you want to grow fast, operate with autonomy, and work on campaigns that reach millions, this is the right environment for you.

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.

  • Ownership of campaigns that directly impact revenue and growth.

  • Exposure to regional markets and cross-functional collaboration.

  • A team that values clear thinking, fast execution, and measurable outcomes.

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform. Headquartered in Malaysia and active in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we simplify access to financial protection through our platform Bjak.com. We use technology, including AI, automation, and data, to deliver insurance that’s faster, smarter, and more inclusive.

If you're ready to run performance campaigns that scale, drive growth through data, and learn fast in a startup that doesn’t slow down, we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Telesales & Onboarding Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Bring Merchants Onboard. Power the Growth.
At Bjak, we’re building one of the fastest-growing platforms in the region. We’re looking for a motivated Telesales & Onboarding Executive to drive merchant acquisition, manage end-to-end onboarding, and ensure our partners experience a seamless journey joining us. With a competitive basic salary plus commission package, this role is perfect for someone hungry to build relationships and close deals fast.

You’ll Excel in This Role If You…

  • Pitch and onboard new merchants, ensuring smooth setup and activation on our platform

  • Build strong merchant relationships and act as their go-to point of contact during onboarding

  • Drive revenue growth by identifying opportunities and converting merchants into long-term partners

  • Ensure compliance and accuracy in merchant documentation and onboarding processes

  • Collaborate with sales, operations, and support teams to deliver an excellent onboarding experience

The Right Fit Has…

  • Malaysian nationality (locals only – applicants must be based in Malaysia)

  • 1–3 years of experience in sales, merchant acquisition, or account management (fresh grads with high drive are also welcome)

  • Strong communication, negotiation, and persuasion skills

  • A proven ability to meet and exceed individual sales or onboarding targets

  • High attention to detail with strong organizational skills

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment

Nice to Have

  • Experience in fintech, payments, or merchant services

  • Knowledge of sales CRM tools and onboarding workflows

  • Prior experience in startups or high-growth companies

Why Join Bjak

  • Basic salary + attractive commission package – your earnings grow with your results.

  • Be part of Southeast Asia’s leading insurance and financial marketplace.

  • Fast-paced, growth-focused environment with plenty of room to excel.

  • Work alongside passionate teams across sales, operations, and product.

  • Career growth opportunities with strong performance-based rewards.

About Bjak

Bjak is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies – from custom APIs to AI-driven engines – are designed to simplify previously complex services, from insurance to investments.

We operate across Malaysia, China, Thailand, Indonesia, Taiwan, Japan, and Singapore, and are building next-generation AI systems to transform how people experience financial services in ASEAN.

If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast, build strong merchant relationships, and maximize your earnings – join us.

jobs.title: Script & Content Writer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Craft Stories. Capture Attention. Drive Engagement.
At BJAK, we believe stories inspire trust, spark curiosity, and create real connections. As we expand our creative content efforts, we’re looking for a Script & Content Writer who can transform ideas into compelling scripts, storylines, and narratives for social media, short podcasts, and video shoots. Someone who can write with flair, think creatively, and bring structure to content that entertains, informs, and engages audiences at scale.

This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-moving startup culture, understands how to tell stories across different formats, and loves the challenge of creating content that people can’t scroll past.

Why This Role Matters

  • You’ll craft the scripts and storylines that bring our content vision to life across multiple platforms.

  • Your writing will set the tone for how our audience perceives, engages with, and remembers BJAK.

  • You’ll play a key role in building a creative content engine that scales across social media, podcasts, and short-form video.

  • You’ll help us experiment with fresh formats and ideas that push the boundaries of digital storytelling.

What You’ll Do

  • Write scripts, storylines, and dialogues for social media content, podcasts, and short-form video shoots.

  • Create engaging captions, hooks, and copy tailored for platforms like TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, and more.

  • Collaborate with video producers, designers, and the creative team to ensure content flows seamlessly from script to screen.

  • Research cultural trends, audience interests, and viral formats to inspire fresh, relevant content ideas.

  • Adapt tone and storytelling style for different objectives – educational, entertaining, inspiring, or promotional.

  • Contribute to brainstorming sessions, content calendars, and ideation of new formats.

  • Ensure all content is original, on-brand, and aligned with BJAK’s voice and goals.

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Love storytelling and can write scripts that feel natural, engaging, and impactful.

  • Are endlessly curious about trends, culture, and what makes people click “watch.”

  • Can switch styles easily – from witty and casual to professional and polished.

  • Move fast and don’t get stuck waiting for perfect – you believe in testing, iterating, and improving.

  • Enjoy working closely with creatives, producers, and marketers to bring ideas to life.

  • Think like an owner – you care about how your work performs, not just how it reads.

What You Bring

  • 1–3 years of experience in scriptwriting, content writing, or related creative fields (fresh grads with strong writing portfolios are welcome).

  • Strong writing and storytelling skills – especially for video and social-first content.

  • Understanding of social media trends, platforms, and content formats.

  • Ability to brainstorm, pitch ideas, and turn concepts into polished scripts.

  • Excellent command of English (Malay is a plus).

  • A portfolio or examples of past creative work (scripts, content, short-form writing).

Nice to Have

  • Experience writing for podcasts, video production, or creative campaigns.

  • Familiarity with storyboarding, creative direction, or video editing.

  • Passion for film, media, or entertainment content.

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive compensation package.

  • High ownership of creative content across multiple formats.

  • Exposure to fast-growth startup projects that reach audiences regionally.

  • A collaborative environment where ideas are heard, tested, and executed.

  • The chance to shape BJAK’s creative storytelling voice from the ground up.


Our Team & Culture

We move fast, think creatively, and execute relentlessly. At BJAK, we value ownership, speed, and outcomes over process and hierarchy. Everyone contributes directly, whether you’re writing a script, brainstorming a new podcast format, or helping refine the flow of a video edit.

If you care about storytelling that resonates and want to create content that leaves a mark, this is your kind of team.

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform. Headquartered in Malaysia with operations in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we help millions of users access transparent, affordable financial protection. Through automation, AI, and intelligent systems, we simplify complex financial services and make them faster, smarter, and more accessible to all.

jobs.title: Assistant HR Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Be a Hands-On HR Leader in a Fast-Growth Environment

At BJAK, we operate with speed, ownership, and a clear mission: to make financial services more accessible, affordable, and impactful. As our Assistant HR Manager, you’ll support the HR leadership team in building scalable people processes, managing day-to-day HR operations, and driving initiatives that strengthen employee experience, performance, and culture.

This role is ideal for someone who is ready to step up from an HR generalist/specialist role into leadership, combining operational excellence with strategic exposure in a high-growth, startup environment.

Why This Role Matters

The Assistant HR Manager will play a crucial role in ensuring our people operations run smoothly while supporting the HR Manager and senior leaders in delivering strategic initiatives. You will balance hands-on execution with managerial oversight, helping BJAK build a high-performance workforce and a thriving culture.

What You’ll Do

HR Operations & Compliance

  • Oversee daily HR operations including onboarding, confirmation, leave, payroll coordination, and exit processes.

  • Ensure compliance with employment laws and HR policies across multiple jurisdictions.

  • Maintain and improve HR systems, processes, and documentation.

Talent Acquisition & Development

  • Support recruitment activities including screening, interviews, and coordination with hiring managers.

  • Partner with HR leadership to design and implement training, upskilling, and career development programs.

  • Assist in succession planning and workforce planning activities.

Performance & Employee Relations

  • Guide managers through performance management cycles, probation evaluations, and disciplinary processes.

  • Provide support in handling employee relations cases, escalating complex matters to HR leadership.

  • Champion employee engagement and well-being initiatives.

Culture & Engagement

  • Help design and execute employee engagement activities such as townhalls, recognition programs, and surveys.

  • Act as a culture ambassador, ensuring BJAK’s values are reflected in all people processes.

Leadership & Support

  • Provide coaching and guidance to junior HR staff.

  • Act as a deputy to the HR Manager, stepping in to represent HR in meetings when needed.

  • Support HR leadership with reports, analytics, and project implementation.

You’ll Thrive Here If You…

  • Are excited about hands-on HR execution with exposure to strategy.

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where priorities shift quickly.

  • Value accountability, openness, and speed over bureaucracy.

  • Are detail-oriented but also able to see the bigger picture.

What You Bring

  • 5+ years of progressive HR experience, ideally across HR operations, employee relations, and recruitment.

  • Solid knowledge of employment law, compliance, and HR best practices in Malaysia and/or regional markets.

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and build trust across teams.

  • Experience in managing or mentoring junior HR staff is an advantage.

  • Proficiency in HR systems and data reporting.

  • Resilience, adaptability, and eagerness to grow into a future HR leadership role.

What You’ll Get

  • Competitive compensation aligned with your experience.

  • Exposure to strategic HR leadership and decision-making.

  • Opportunity to step into a leadership track within HR.

  • A flat, execution-focused culture where initiative is recognized.

  • Fast-paced learning and the chance to build HR processes at scale in one of Southeast Asia’s leading fintech startups.

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform, operating in Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Singapore, Taiwan, China, and Japan. We simplify complex financial services through technology and AI, making protection easier to access for millions of users.

Our team is lean, driven, and focused on impact. We work hard, move fast, and hold high standards – because we believe what we’re building matters.

If you’re looking to grow into a strong HR leader while making a real impact, we’d love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Data Entry Admin
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Bjak is focused on providing access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance portal in Southeast Asia. Our main portal, Bjak.my, helps millions find the insurance policy with the best value and highest coverage for them.

Our core strengths are in navigating the most complex regulations and environments, creating some of the most innovative products in the world. For instance, we are the first platform globally to simplify and offer investment-linked life and health insurance online, coupled with an instant talk-to-agent service. We are seeking a Customer Service Representative to join our passionate team and help us maintain our commitment to excellence.

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Data Entry Admin to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a key role in ensuring the efficient operation of our office by providing administrative support and coordinating various tasks and functions. If you are detail-oriented, resourceful, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Generate insurance quotations based on customer needs and policy requirements.

  • Prepare cover notes for approved insurance policies.

  • Request necessary documents from customers, such as grants, vehicle photos, transfer of ownership slips, and MYJPJ applications, to facilitate cover note issuance.

  • Review cover notes and documents submitted by customers to verify accuracy and completeness, enabling policy activation.

  • Liaise with insurance providers to follow up on pending approval cases and ensure timely processing.

  • Address customer complaints and inquiries related to cover notes, providing excellent service and resolution.

  • Maintain organized records of insurance policies, cover notes, and customer interactions.

  • Collaborate with the insurance team to improve administrative processes and workflows.

  • Perform other administrative tasks and support functions as required by management

Requirements:

  • Minimum Diploma qualification or equivalent certification in insurance or a related field

  • Strong attention to detail with excellent organizational skills

  • Fast learner with strong problem-solving abilities

  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal

  • Able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team

  • Open to local candidates only

Preferred:

  • Prior experience in administrative or insurance-related roles

  • Good understanding of insurance policies, cover notes, and related processes

  • Immediate availability is an advantage

Benefit:

  • International work environment and flat organization

  • Team culture - highly practical and results oriented.

  • Free training and development, constantly improve yourself.

  • Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems

  • Competitive salary

  • International work environment and flat organization

  • Progress like never before. remarkable level of progress.

jobs.title: Regional Talent Acquisition Lead (China - Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build the Team That Builds the Future

At BJAK, we believe world-class products start with world-class people. We're expanding our talent footprint and looking for a China Lead, Talent Acquisition to drive our hiring efforts in China - supporting our Malaysia HQ remotely.

In this strategic role, you’ll take full ownership of end-to-end hiring for our China-based and remote roles, partnering closely with hiring managers across engineering, AI, operations, and more. You’ll identify, attract, and secure top-tier, mission-aligned talent who will help us build the future of financial access across Southeast Asia and beyond.

What You’ll Do

  • Own full-cycle hiring across diverse functions, with a strong focus on tech, product, and high-growth teams.

  • Act as a talent quality gatekeeper - screening CVs, portfolios, and assessing signals beyond the resume to identify top potential.

  • Proactively source exceptional candidates via platforms, communities, networks, and creative strategies.

  • Partner closely with hiring managers to deeply understand business needs, define role requirements, and co-design effective hiring processes.

  • Conduct meaningful interviews that uncover true potential and values alignment.

  • Deliver structured feedback to both candidates and internal teams, enabling data-informed decisions.

  • Ensure an excellent candidate experience through transparent communication and timely updates.

  • Manage and improve the hiring funnel using ATS and recruitment metrics.

  • Keep a pulse on talent trends in China, and bring insights to shape hiring strategies.

What We’re Looking For

  • You see recruiting as more than filling roles - you’re building winning, aligned teams.

  • You’re independent, resourceful, and relentless in sourcing and closing top talent.

  • You thrive in fast-paced, high-autonomy environments and are not afraid to challenge the norm.

  • You understand and care deeply about the candidate experience, especially in a cross-border context.

  • You have high emotional intelligence, strong judgment, and know how to assess more than just hard skills.

  • You’re China market-savvy, startup-aligned, and outcome-driven—willing to go the extra mile to get hires across the line.

You’ll Excel in This Role If You…

  • Have an eye for exceptional talent and can spot high-performers beyond their resumes.

  • Are organized and detail-oriented, able to juggle multiple roles and hiring timelines.

  • Communicate clearly and confidently with both internal stakeholders and candidates.

  • Love to build and optimize - whether that’s processes, pipelines, or playbooks.

  • Take full ownership from first outreach to offer stage.

  • Move fast, but thoughtfully, always balancing quality and urgency.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of full-cycle recruitment experience, preferably in tech, startup, or growth environments.

  • Proven success hiring across multiple functions and levels.

  • Deep familiarity with modern sourcing tools, ATS platforms, and recruitment best practices.

  • Strong communication, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Comfortable working remotely and independently, aligning across borders and time zones.

  • Fluent in Chinese and English (both written and spoken).

Nice to Have

  • Experience hiring in AI, product, or software engineering functions.

  • Knowledge of China's talent landscape, job boards, and professional communities.

  • Exposure to employer branding or recruitment marketing.

  • Familiarity with regional hiring across Southeast Asia.

  • Experience working in a remote-first, high-growth company.

Why Join BJAK?

  • Competitive above-market compensation

  • Fully remote with high ownership and autonomy

  • A mission with real-world impact

  • Flat, collaborative culture that values ideas over hierarchy

  • Rapid growth and leadership exposure

  • A chance to shape the future of financial access across Asia

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we simplify and democratize financial products - insurance, loans, and investments - using proprietary AI and automation. With millions of users across Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, BJAK is building the next generation of intelligent financial systems that are inclusive, intuitive, and transformative.

If you're ready to build teams that power the future - apply now.

jobs.title: Tech Recruiter (China, Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Hire Fast. Hire Right. Build the Future.

At BJAK, we move fast, and we expect our hiring to keep up. We’re looking for a Technical Recruiter who’s obsessed with results, thrives in chaos, and gets the job done. You’ll be the one turning urgent headcount into hired engineers and tech leaders. If the pipeline isn’t moving, you’ll push it. If candidates go silent, you’ll bring them back. If the role is hard to fill, you’ll find a way.

This is not a coordination role. This is a builder’s role. You’ll own technical hiring from end to end, work directly with engineering and product leaders, and make sure every critical role gets filled fast and with quality.

What You’ll Do

  • Take full ownership of technical roles from intake to offer

  • Proactively source candidates across multiple platforms, communities, and channels

  • Monitor pipeline velocity, spot bottlenecks early, and resolve them aggressively

  • Push hiring teams and candidates to keep processes moving — no unnecessary delays

  • Drive structured interviews and guide interviewers on consistency and candidate experience

jobs.title: Senior Recruiter (Indonesia, Remote – Global Hiring)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build the Team That Builds the Future

At BJAK, we believe growth only happens when the right people are in the right seats. We’re looking for a Senior Recruiter based in Indonesia who is not just a talent sourcer but a hiring driver – someone who ensures we meet ambitious global hiring targets with both speed and quality.

You will work remotely, closely with our Malaysia HQ team, and play a critical role in building the team that drives BJAK’s regional and global expansion.

This role demands resilience, accountability, and relentless execution. You will own hiring outcomes end-to-end: daily headhunting, zero-backlog pipelines, high-quality candidate delivery, and strict target achievement. If you thrive in intensity and want to prove yourself in a results-driven global environment, this role is for you.

What You’ll Do

  • Take full ownership of hiring outcomes - judged by quality, speed, and target achievement.

  • Headhunt 150–200 profiles daily, while clearing all screenings to zero backlog each day.

  • Run daily progress updates and meetings with the Malaysia team to track numbers and pipeline health.

  • Maintain strict daily screening quality scores - only top candidates move forward.

  • Source aggressively using LinkedIn, direct headhunting, referrals, social platforms, and beyond.

  • Partner with hiring managers globally to define requirements and deliver ready-to-interview shortlists fast.

  • Ensure no delays or drop-offs in candidate or manager progression.

  • Mentor junior recruiters, raising standards of execution and output.

  • Stay sharp on market trends, competitor moves, and best practices in global recruitment.

What We’re Looking For

  • You treat recruitment as mission-critical - not HR admin, but a growth engine.

  • You’re hungry, disciplined, and thrive in high-pressure, fast-paced environments.

  • You are ready to work beyond standard hours - whenever the business demands.

  • You maintain high etiquette and professionalism when responding to leadership, even after hours.

  • You thrive on targets and scoreboards, with your performance measured daily.

  • You don’t wait to be told - you anticipate, act, and deliver without reminders.

  • You’re resilient: rejection, pressure, or criticism only fuel you to do better.

jobs.title: Regional Talent Acquisition Lead (Indonesia, Remote)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build the Team That Builds the Future

At BJAK, we believe world-class products start with world-class people. We're expanding our talent footprint and looking for an Indonesia Lead, Talent Acquisition to drive our hiring efforts in Indonesia - supporting our Malaysia HQ remotely.

In this strategic role, you’ll take full ownership of end-to-end hiring for our Indonesia -based and remote roles, partnering closely with hiring managers across engineering, AI, operations, and more. You’ll identify, attract, and secure top-tier, mission-aligned talent who will help us build the future of financial access across Southeast Asia and beyond.

What You’ll Do

  • Own full-cycle hiring across diverse functions, with a strong focus on tech, product, and high-growth teams.

  • Act as a talent quality gatekeeper - screening CVs, portfolios, and assessing signals beyond the resume to identify top potential.

  • Proactively source exceptional candidates via platforms, communities, networks, and creative strategies.

  • Partner closely with hiring managers to deeply understand business needs, define role requirements, and co-design effective hiring processes.

  • Conduct meaningful interviews that uncover true potential and values alignment.

  • Deliver structured feedback to both candidates and internal teams, enabling data-informed decisions.

  • Ensure an excellent candidate experience through transparent communication and timely updates.

  • Manage and improve the hiring funnel using ATS and recruitment metrics.

  • Keep a pulse on talent trends in Indonesia, and bring insights to shape hiring strategies.

What We’re Looking For

  • You see recruiting as more than filling roles - you’re building winning, aligned teams.

  • You’re independent, resourceful, and relentless in sourcing and closing top talent.

  • You thrive in fast-paced, high-autonomy environments and are not afraid to challenge the norm.

  • You understand and care deeply about the candidate experience, especially in a cross-border context.

  • You have high emotional intelligence, strong judgment, and know how to assess more than just hard skills.

  • You’re Indonesia market-savvy, startup-aligned, and outcome-driven—willing to go the extra mile to get hires across the line.

You’ll Excel in This Role If You…

  • Have an eye for exceptional talent and can spot high-performers beyond their resumes.

  • Are organized and detail-oriented, able to juggle multiple roles and hiring timelines.

  • Communicate clearly and confidently with both internal stakeholders and candidates.

  • Love to build and optimize - whether that’s processes, pipelines, or playbooks.

  • Take full ownership from first outreach to offer stage.

  • Move fast, but thoughtfully, always balancing quality and urgency.

Requirements

  • 4+ years of full-cycle recruitment experience, preferably in tech, startup, or growth environments.

  • Proven success hiring across multiple functions and levels.

  • Deep familiarity with modern sourcing tools, ATS platforms, and recruitment best practices.

  • Strong communication, relationship-building, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Comfortable working remotely and independently, aligning across borders and time zones.

  • Fluent in English (both written and spoken).

Nice to Have

  • Experience hiring in AI, product, or software engineering functions.

  • Knowledge of Indonesia's talent landscape, job boards, and professional communities.

  • Exposure to employer branding or recruitment marketing.

  • Familiarity with regional hiring across Southeast Asia.

  • Experience working in a remote-first, high-growth company.

Why Join BJAK?

  • Competitive above-market compensation

  • Fully remote with high ownership and autonomy

  • A mission with real-world impact

  • Flat, collaborative culture that values ideas over hierarchy

  • Rapid growth and leadership exposure

  • A chance to shape the future of financial access across Asia

If you're ready to build teams that power the future - apply now.

jobs.title: Campaign Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Bjak is focused on providing access to affordable and sustainable financial services for people in ASEAN. Headquartered in Malaysia, Bjak is the largest insurance portal in Southeast Asia. Our main portal, Bjak.com, helps millions find the insurance policy with the best value and highest coverage for them. Our investments in technology such as Custom API, trading systems and data science is to enable easy access to financial services that were previously inaccessible or difficult to understand. Join us on this exciting journey as we expand our operations in Malaysia. We're looking for dynamic individuals who share our vision and want to contribute to the next chapter of Bjak's success.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute marketing campaigns to drive engagement, lead generation, and brand awareness.

  • Collaborate with content creators, designers, and other stakeholders to create compelling campaign assets.

  • Monitor campaign performance and optimize based on data-driven insights.

  • Manage budgets, timelines, and resources for campaign execution.

  • Build and nurture an active and engaged online and offline community.

  • Develop strategies to increase user participation and brand loyalty.

  • Moderate community discussions, respond to inquiries, and provide exceptional customer engagement.

  • Organize and host events (both virtual and in-person) to strengthen community connections.

  • Oversee content strategy for social media, newsletters, and community channels.

  • Ensure consistent brand voice and messaging across platforms.

  • Identify and leverage user-generated content to enhance engagement.

  • Track and analyze social media/community metrics and report on key insights.

  • Identify and collaborate with influencers, brand advocates, and industry partners.

  • Develop programs to encourage community members to become brand ambassadors.

  • Manage relationships with key stakeholders to expand the brand’s reach.

  • Identify issues and opportunities through in-depth data analysis and present relevant findings to facilitate business decisions and campaign design.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years’ experience in (digital) marketing with experience in campaign management & content journey development.

  • Excellent understanding of digital communication, social media management, and event planning skills.

  • Familiarity with community platforms (e.g., Discord, Facebook Groups, LinkedIn), CRM tools, and analytics.

  • Completed university degree in the field of marketing / communication science / business administration or a comparable qualification.

  • Excellent communication and influencing skills required. Must demonstrate analytical and strategic thinking.

  • Proven to deliver challenging results and clear demonstration of strong project management and critical thinking.

  • Proactive attitude, willing to go above and beyond, highly adaptable to changes.

Benefits

At Bjak, we offer the opportunity to be part of a fast-growing company at the forefront of innovation in financial services. As the Campaign Manager, you will play a key role in driving the success of our marketing team while working in a dynamic, supportive, and collaborative environment.

Joining Bjak offers:

  • The chance to make an immediate impact on Bjak’s success in Malaysia.

  • A creative and flexible work environment that encourages innovation.

  • Competitive compensation, benefits, and opportunities for professional growth.

jobs.title: Videographer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies - from custom APIs to AI-driven engines - are designed to simplify previously complex or inaccessible services, from insurance to investments.

We operate across Malaysia, Taiwan, and Japan, and are building next-generation AI systems to transform how people experience financial services in ASEAN.

If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast, think big, and make a meaningful impact - join us

About the Job

  • Plan, shoot, and edit engaging video content tailored for various platforms including YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, and Xiaohongshu (XHS).

  • Produce visually compelling content that drives viewership, enhances engagement, and supports campaign KPIs.

  • Develop creative formats and storytelling approaches that keep content fresh, modern, and on-trend.

  • Execute professional-level editing, including color grading, sound design, motion graphics, and subtitling.

  • Manage multiple editing projects simultaneously while ensuring all deliverables are on time, on brand, and of consistent quality.

  • Maintain high technical accuracy and visual alignment with the company’s branding and style guidelines.

  • Partner with the Creative, Social Media, and Marketing teams in brainstorming and concept development.

  • Work closely with designers, copywriters, and strategists to translate weekly content plans into visually impactful videos.

  • Oversee the full post-production pipeline, from media management and file optimization to platform-specific formatting.

  • Maintain an organized archive of raw footage, assets, and project files for future use.

  • Troubleshoot technical or production issues to ensure smooth execution across all stages.

  • Stay ahead of evolving social and digital trends, tools, and content formats.

  • Experiment with new storytelling styles and video techniques to boost audience engagement and reach.

Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Film, Multimedia, Communication, or related field

  • 2+ years of experience in videography, video editing, or related creative roles

  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, or other video editing software

  • Strong creative eye for visual composition, storytelling, and pacing

  • Strong understanding of social media platforms, video algorithms, and audience engagement strategies.

  • Experience with different camera systems, lighting setups, and sound recording

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while maintaining attention to detail.

  • A portfolio or showreel of past work is required

Why Join BJAK

  • Above-market remuneration

  • Fast-track career growth & exposure

  • Meaningful, mission-driven work

  • Collaborative and inclusive team culture

  • Flat structure - ideas and initiative matter more than titles

  • High autonomy, real responsibility, and unlimited growth potential

jobs.title: Senior Videographer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies - from custom APIs to AI-driven engines - are designed to simplify previously complex or inaccessible services, from insurance to investments.

If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast, think big, and make meaningful impact - join us.

About the Job

As a Senior Videographer, you will lead the creative execution and visual storytelling of BJAK’s video content across platforms. You’ll drive concept development, manage end-to-end production, and elevate the visual quality of all marketing and brand materials. This role is ideal for a hands-on creator with strong leadership instincts and a passion for crafting visually powerful narratives that connect with audiences.

Key Responsibilities

Creative Direction & Production

  • Lead planning, storyboarding, and execution of high-quality video content across YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, and Xiaohongshu (XHS).

  • Develop and own creative concepts that enhance brand storytelling, drive engagement, and align with campaign objectives.

  • Set visual direction and ensure all content reflects BJAK’s tone, style, and brand identity.

  • Produce visually compelling content — from corporate storytelling to fast-turnaround social videos.

Post-Production Excellence

  • Oversee and execute professional-level editing, including color grading, sound design, motion graphics, and subtitling.

  • Manage multiple projects concurrently with high attention to quality, consistency, and delivery timelines.

  • Establish best practices and editing standards to maintain visual coherence across all BJAK content.

Team Collaboration & Mentorship

  • Work closely with the Creative, Marketing, and Social Media teams to bring ideas to life through strong visual narratives.

  • Mentor junior videographers or editors, providing feedback and creative guidance.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with designers, copywriters, and strategists to deliver cohesive content campaigns.

Production & Workflow Management

  • Oversee the full production pipeline — from media management and equipment setup to file optimization and export.

  • Maintain organized archives of raw footage, assets, and project files for easy access and reuse.

  • Troubleshoot technical or production issues to ensure smooth and efficient execution.

Innovation & Trend Leadership

  • Stay ahead of video trends, emerging formats, and creative tools to ensure BJAK’s content remains fresh and relevant.

  • Experiment with new storytelling techniques and visual styles to increase audience reach and retention.

  • Continuously improve production workflows to enhance speed and quality.

Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Film, Multimedia, Communication, or a related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in videography, video editing, and creative production (agency or in-house experience preferred).

  • Strong portfolio or showreel showcasing diverse video styles and storytelling techniques.

  • Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop, Audition).

  • Skilled in camera operations, lighting setups, and audio recording.

  • Deep understanding of social media platforms, video algorithms, and content optimization.

  • Strong sense of visual storytelling, composition, pacing, and attention to detail.

  • Ability to manage multiple projects independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

  • Experience leading small production teams or freelancers is a plus.

Why Join BJAK

  • Above-market remuneration.

  • Fast-track career growth & regional exposure.

  • Meaningful, mission-driven work that impacts millions.

  • Collaborative and inclusive team culture.

  • Flat structure — ideas and initiative matter more than titles.

  • High autonomy, real responsibility, and unlimited growth potential.

We’re looking for a Video Editor (Social Media Content) who lives and breathes short-form storytelling. You’ll edit videos designed to capture attention, drive engagement, and spark conversations across platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, Facebook, and Xiaohongshu (XHS).

This role suits someone with a strong sense of timing, trends, and platform behavior — someone who can turn raw footage into scroll-stopping content that feels native, fresh, and on-brand.

Key Responsibilities

Editing & Storytelling

  • Edit short-form videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, Facebook, and XHS.

  • Craft visually engaging edits with strong hooks, pacing, and storytelling flow.

  • Add subtitles, transitions, music, and visual effects to enhance impact and watch time.

  • Adapt content across different platforms while maintaining consistency in tone and message.

Creative Collaboration

  • Work closely with the Creative, Social Media, and Marketing teams to bring campaign concepts and weekly content calendars to life.

  • Contribute ideas on creative formats, editing styles, and content directions aligned with current trends.

  • Support videographers by refining and repurposing raw footage into final deliverables.

Trend & Platform Awareness

  • Stay ahead of social media trends, editing styles, and viral formats across platforms.

  • Monitor competitor and influencer content to identify best practices and new creative ideas.

  • Continuously test and refine editing techniques to improve engagement metrics.

Workflow & Quality Management

  • Maintain organized project files, media archives, and version control.

  • Ensure all outputs are optimized for each platform’s specifications (ratios, length, resolution).

  • Deliver projects on time while maintaining creative quality and consistency.

Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Film, Multimedia, Communications, or related field.

  • 1–3 years of experience in short-form video editing or social media content production.

  • Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, or DaVinci Resolve.

  • Keen eye for pacing, storytelling, and on-platform tone of voice.

  • Able to work independently in a fast-paced environment with tight turnaround times.

  • Fast-track career growth with regional exposure.

  • Collaborative and inclusive creative culture.

  • Flat structure — ideas and initiative matter more than titles.

  • Above-market remuneration with performance-based growth opportunities.

jobs.title: Motion Graphic Artist
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies - from custom APIs to AI-driven engines - are designed to simplify previously complex or inaccessible services, from insurance to investments.

We operate across Malaysia, Taiwan, and Japan, and are building next-generation AI systems to transform how people experience financial services in ASEAN.

If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast, think big, and make meaningful impact - join us.

About the Job

We’re looking for a Motion Graphic Artist with strong visual storytelling instincts and a passion for bringing ideas to life through motion. You’ll create dynamic animations, explainer videos, and visually captivating assets that amplify BJAK’s campaigns, products, and brand stories across multiple platforms.

This role suits someone who blends creativity with technical precision — an artist who can visualize complex ideas and turn them into engaging motion visuals that connect with audiences.

Key Responsibilities

Creative Design & Animation

  • Conceptualize and design motion graphics for marketing campaigns, social media, website, and product explainers.

  • Create engaging 2D animations, kinetic typography, and infographics that communicate ideas effectively.

  • Develop storyboards, style frames, and visual treatments that align with creative briefs and brand identity.

  • Animate existing design assets (illustrations, logos, icons, characters) for promotional videos or product demos.

Collaboration & Execution

  • Work closely with the Creative, Marketing, and Product teams to translate concepts into impactful motion visuals.

  • Collaborate with videographers, video editors, and designers to integrate animations seamlessly into video content.

  • Participate in brainstorming and ideation sessions to enhance storytelling through motion.

Technical Excellence

  • Ensure all motion graphics are optimized for various platforms (social media, digital ads, web).

  • Manage project files, templates, and design assets in an organized and scalable way.

  • Troubleshoot animation and rendering issues to maintain output quality.

Trend & Innovation Awareness

  • Stay updated on the latest motion design trends, tools, and animation techniques.

  • Experiment with new visual styles, transitions, and effects to keep content fresh and modern.

  • Contribute creative ideas for improving audience engagement through animation.

Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Motion Graphics, Animation, Multimedia Design, or related field.

  • 3+ years of experience in motion design, animation, or related creative production.

  • Proficient in Adobe After Effects, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and related tools.

  • Strong sense of composition, timing, color, and typography.

  • Experience creating motion graphics for digital and social media platforms.

  • Ability to balance creativity with technical precision and brand consistency.

  • Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively under tight timelines.

Why Join BJAK

  • Above-market remuneration and creative growth opportunities.

  • Exposure to regional campaigns across multiple markets.

  • Fast-paced, collaborative, and idea-driven environment.

  • Flat structure — initiative and creativity valued over hierarchy.

  • Work with a talented creative team shaping the next generation of fintech storytelling.

  • A portfolio or showreel demonstrating motion graphics and animation work is required.

jobs.title: Senior Motion Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies — from custom APIs to AI-driven engines — are designed to simplify previously complex or inaccessible services, from insurance to investments.

We operate across Malaysia, Taiwan, and Japan, and are building next-generation AI systems to transform how people experience financial services in ASEAN.

If you're looking for a company where you can grow fast, think big, and make meaningful impact — join us.

About the Job

We’re looking for a Senior Motion Designer to lead the creative vision, design direction, and animation execution for motion-based projects across BJAK’s marketing and product campaigns.

In this role, you’ll craft visually stunning motion graphics and animations that communicate ideas clearly, engage audiences emotionally, and elevate the BJAK brand across digital and social platforms. You’ll also mentor junior designers and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to bring concepts to life through motion.

Key Responsibilities

Creative Direction & Motion Design

  • Lead the design and animation of motion graphics for marketing campaigns, product explainers, social content, and digital ads.

  • Conceptualize and develop storyboards, design frames, and animation sequences that align with creative briefs and brand objectives.

  • Ensure all motion visuals maintain consistency, technical quality, and alignment with BJAK’s visual identity.

  • Elevate the overall design quality through creative experimentation, thoughtful art direction, and attention to storytelling.

Collaboration & Leadership

  • Work closely with the Creative, Marketing, and Product teams to interpret campaign objectives into motion-driven content.

  • Mentor and provide feedback to junior motion designers, ensuring creative growth and alignment with project goals.

  • Partner with videographers, video editors, and graphic designers to produce cohesive multimedia content.

  • Present and justify design concepts to stakeholders, translating complex ideas into clear creative direction.

Technical & Workflow Mastery

  • Oversee the motion production pipeline — from concept to delivery — ensuring efficiency and technical excellence.

  • Create reusable templates and design systems to streamline future production.

  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously, balancing creative innovation with timely delivery.

  • Troubleshoot animation, rendering, or visual effects issues to maintain output quality.

Trend & Innovation

  • Stay at the forefront of motion design trends, animation techniques, and new creative tools.

  • Experiment with advanced visual effects, 3D animation, and emerging digital formats.

  • Continuously push creative boundaries to set new benchmarks for visual storytelling within the team.

Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Motion Graphics, Animation, Multimedia Design, or related field.

  • 5+ years of professional experience in motion design, animation, or creative production.

  • Expert proficiency in Adobe After Effects, Illustrator, Photoshop, Premiere Pro, and other motion design tools (e.g., Cinema 4D, Blender is a plus).

  • Strong sense of storytelling, timing, and visual composition.

  • Proven ability to lead creative direction and guide teams toward impactful visual outcomes.

  • Excellent project management, organization, and communication skills.

  • A portfolio or showreel demonstrating advanced motion design and animation work is required.

Why Join BJAK

  • Above-market remuneration and fast-track career growth.

  • Opportunity to lead motion design direction for a regional brand.

  • Collaborative, innovative, and idea-driven creative culture.

  • Exposure to multi-market campaigns and global-level creative standards.

  • Flat structure — creativity and initiative matter more than titles.

  • Work on meaningful projects that make an impact across Southeast Asia.

jobs.title: Customer Concierge Executive (24/7 VIP Support) - October intake
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Role

We are looking for a Customer Concierge Executive (24/7 VIP Support) to deliver premium, personalized assistance to our VIP customers. You will be the key point of contact handling live WhatsApp chats and calls 24/7, ensuring high-value clients receive fast, empathetic, and exceptional service at any hour.

This role suits individuals who take pride in providing top-tier customer experiences, thrive in fast-paced environments, and are comfortable working on a 24/7 rotational schedule.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide real-time support to VIP customers via WhatsApp, calls, and other communication channels, ensuring prompt and professional responses.

  • Handle inquiries, requests, and complaints with empathy, patience, and accuracy.

  • Maintain service excellence during 24/7 operations, including day, night, weekend, and public holiday shifts (rotational basis).

  • Proactively identify customer needs and follow through to ensure complete satisfaction.

  • Coordinate with internal teams (Product, Tech, Operations, Admin) to resolve customer issues quickly.

  • Record and track all customer interactions accurately in CRM systems for smooth shift handovers.

  • Uphold company standards by ensuring every VIP experience feels personalized and premium.

Requirements

  • Proven experience in Customer Service, Concierge, or VIP Support, ideally within tech, e-commerce, travel, or hospitality sectors.
