  • Willing and able to work on rotational 24/7 shifts, including nights, weekends, and public holidays.

  • Strong interpersonal, problem-solving, and multitasking skills.

  • Tech-savvy, adaptable, and comfortable using multiple digital platforms simultaneously.

  • A team player with a passion for delivering outstanding customer experiences.

What We Offer

  • Competitive base salary, shift allowance, and performance incentives.

  • Opportunity to work with high-value clients in a fast-scaling tech environment.

  • Career growth pathways in Customer Experience and Operations leadership.

  • Supportive, collaborative team culture that values excellence and empathy.

jobs.title: Chief of Staff
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Be the engine behind execution, clarity, and scale

At BJAK, we are building Southeast Asia’s leading digital financial platform - fast. Our mission is to simplify access to insurance and financial services for millions, and we’re moving at startup speed to get there. As Chief of Staff you’ll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the founder to turn vision into execution, and execution into results.

This is not a coordinator role. It’s a high-trust, high-responsibility position for someone who thrives in chaos, owns outcomes end-to-end, and shows up every day ready to push harder. Own cross-functional problems and fix them like the company’s future depends on it - because you’re personally invested in seeing it succeed.

Why this role matters

  • Translate the CEO’s vision into clear, actionable priorities across the company

  • Accelerate strategic execution and ensure consistent follow-through across teams

  • Operate as a central hub of communication, planning, and coordination for leadership

  • Solve high-impact problems with a bias for speed, structure, and accountability

  • Help scale the company by building systems and momentum in a fast-moving environment

What You Will Do

i) Strategic Planning and Execution

  • Partner with the CEO to define, track, and drive progress on strategic priorities, OKRs, and company-wide initiatives

  • Ensure timely execution and alignment of cross-functional projects

  • Identify operational gaps or inefficiencies and coordinate solutions that enable scale

ii) Executive Enablement

  • Prepare briefings, analysis, and recommendations to support decision-making at the executive level

  • Optimise the CEO’s time by managing priorities, scheduling, and internal/external communication

  • Draft and refine clear, professional communication materials for internal teams, board members, and investors

iii) Cross-functional Leadership Support

  • Facilitate leadership meetings, off-sites, and decision forums - including agenda setting, documentation, and action tracking

  • Serve as a key liaison across departments to ensure strategic alignment and clarity

  • Partner closely with department heads to surface issues, unblock progress, and maintain execution momentum

iii) Project Ownership

  • Lead cross-functional, high-priority projects that do not have a natural owner

  • Support early-stage strategic initiatives through planning, coordination, and execution

  • Build and implement systems and processes that introduce structure without slowing down the pace

You Will Thrive Here If You...

  • Treat the company’s success as your own, with a deep sense of responsibility and care

  • Thrive in high-speed, ambiguous environments with evolving priorities.

  • Take pride in driving outcomes - not just completing tasks.

  • Work with intensity, integrity, and zero ego. You care about the best outcome, not whose idea it is.

  • Operate with a founder mindset: proactive, resourceful, and focused on what truly moves the needle.

  • Communicate clearly and concisely, especially under pressure.

  • Stay composed in chaos, solve problems independently, and get things done without needing a playbook.

  • Are willing to work beyond typical hours when the mission demands it.

What You Bring

  • 5+ years of experience in consulting, strategy, business operations, or high-growth startups.

  • Proven ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects with minimal direction.

  • Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.

  • Experience working directly with C-level executives and handling high-stakes work.

  • Maturity, discretion, and sound judgment - especially when navigating sensitive or high-pressure situations.

  • Bonus: Background in fintech, digital platforms, or founder-led companies.

  • Based in Malaysia and able to work from our HQ in Petaling Jaya as needed.

Our Team & Culture

We’re a lean, high-performance team that moves fast and holds a high bar. Titles don’t matter here - output, integrity, and ownership do. Everyone is expected to roll up their sleeves, contribute meaningfully, and take initiative.

We reward people who think like owners. We value speed, clarity, and relentless ownership. If you’re hungry to grow and care deeply about excellence, this is your kind of environment.

Why Join Us

  • Above-market compensation for top-tier performance

  • A high-trust role with direct access to executive decision-making and company strategy

  • The opportunity to lead and shape cross-functional initiatives with real impact

  • Career growth into senior leadership roles (e.g., GM, COO, or operational leadership)

  • A mission-driven team that values clarity, speed, and ownership

  • A flat, no-politics culture with a bias for action and accountability

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest digital insurance platform. Headquartered in Malaysia with operations in Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we help millions of users access transparent, affordable financial protection. Through automation, AI, and intelligent systems, we simplify complex financial services, making them faster, more inclusive, and accessible to all.

If you're ready to lead from behind the scenes and help drive the company forward, we welcome you to join us.

jobs.title: Telesales Executive - Merchant Accounts
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Drive Sales. Make an Impact.
At Bjak, we’re on a mission to build one of the fastest-growing platforms in the region — and merchants play a big part in that journey. We’re looking for a Telesales Executive to help us bring more merchants onboard, pitch our solutions with impact, and close deals over the phone.

If you’re persuasive, energetic, and love hitting (and exceeding) targets, this role is made for you.

Your Responsibilities

  • Make outbound calls to prospective merchants to introduce Bjak’s products and partnership opportunities.

  • Understand merchant needs and position Bjak’s solutions effectively to drive sign-ups.

  • Deliver clear and convincing sales pitches, handle objections, and close deals confidently.

  • Manage leads efficiently — follow up, convert prospects, and ensure smooth onboarding.

  • Achieve and exceed daily, weekly, and monthly sales targets.

  • Maintain accurate call logs, lead updates, and conversion records in the CRM system.

  • Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to refine strategies and boost conversion rates.

Who We’re Looking For

  • Locals and based in Malaysia

  • 1–3 years of telesales, telemarketing, or call center experience. (Fresh grads with strong communication skills are encouraged to apply.)

  • Excellent verbal communication in Bahasa Malaysia and English. (Mandarin or Tamil is a plus.)

  • High energy, resilience, and a positive, target-driven attitude.

  • Strong persuasion, negotiation, and problem-solving skills.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in fintech, insurance, or financial services telesales.

  • Familiarity with CRM systems and telesales processes.

  • Proven track record of achieving or surpassing sales targets.

Why Join Bjak

  • Basic salary + attractive commission package — your performance determines your earnings.

  • Join Southeast Asia’s leading insurance and financial marketplace.

  • Work in a fast-paced, growth-driven environment with strong incentives.

  • Be part of a supportive and dynamic sales team.

  • Enjoy real career advancement opportunities based on performance.

About Bjak

Bjak is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies – from custom APIs to AI-driven engines – are designed to simplify previously complex services, from insurance to investments.

We operate across Malaysia, China, Thailand, Indonesia, Taiwan, Japan, and Singapore, and are building next-generation AI systems to transform how people experience financial services in ASEAN.

If you’re looking for a company where you can earn more, grow fast, and make an impact – join us.

jobs.title: Product Designer UI/UX (Indonesia)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Design Seamless, Smart, and Scalable Experiences That Touch Millions

At BJAK, we’re reimagining how users across Southeast Asia experience financial services, and product design sits at the heart of that mission. We’re looking for a Product Designer who obsesses over clarity, simplicity, and building for scale. You’ll be responsible for end-to-end product design, from wireframes to polished UI, working closely with product managers and engineers to craft solutions that are both delightful and impactful.

Why This Role Matters

  • You’ll be designing key user flows across high-impact products, used by millions.

  • You’ll shape the future of financial tools that are simpler, faster, and fairer.

  • You’ll work cross-functionally to bring thoughtful, tested, and scalable designs to life.


What You’ll Do

  • Lead the design process for one or more product areas: from concept to implementation.

  • Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and researchers to define problems and solve them with great UX.

  • Create wireframes, prototypes, user flows, and polished UI designs.

  • Conduct usability testing, gather feedback, and iterate quickly.

  • Contribute to and evolve our design system for consistency and scalability.

  • Advocate for the user and ensure their needs are at the center of every decision.

You’ll Thrive Here If You...

  • Enjoy turning complex flows into simple, elegant user experiences.

  • Can work quickly without sacrificing quality.

  • Embrace feedback, data, and iteration as tools to sharpen your designs.

  • Take ownership of problems and see them through to elegant solutions.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in product design with a portfolio showcasing web/mobile products.

  • Proficiency in Figma and prototyping tools.

  • Familiarity with user research, testing, and agile product teams.

  • Strong understanding of layout, hierarchy, spacing, and interaction design.

  • Based in Indonesia and open to remote work with Southeast Asia team.

  • Please submit your CV along with your portfolio.

Our Team & Culture

We’re a lean, high-performance team that moves fast and holds a high bar. Titles don’t matter here - output, integrity, and ownership do. Everyone is expected to roll up their sleeves, contribute meaningfully, and take initiative.

We reward people who think like owners. We value speed, clarity, and relentless ownership. If you’re hungry to grow and care deeply about excellence, this is your kind of environment.

Why Join BJAK

  • Above-market remuneration

  • Accelerated career growth and leadership exposure

  • Mission-driven work with real impact

  • Collaborative, inclusive, and flat team culture

  • Ideas and ownership matter more than titles

  • High autonomy and unlimited learning potential

About BJAK

BJAK is Southeast Asia’s largest insurance and financial services platform. Headquartered in Malaysia, we help millions of users access affordable, transparent, and simplified financial products through Bjak.com. Our proprietary technologies—from custom APIs to AI-powered engines - are designed to make complex services like insurance and investments accessible and intuitive.

We operate across Malaysia, Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, and are building next-gen AI systems to transform how financial services are delivered in the region.

If you’re ready to think big, move fast, and help build the teams that build the future - apply now.
